channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OK
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OK

item.title: Report E-2023090528
item.description:
Report E-2023090528

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-21T15:10:31+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-07
  • City: DURANT
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSH experienced a customer location release of UN1791 Sodium Hypochlorite 12.5% from a 55-gallon poly drum. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-teaspoon of material released the drum lid only. The vented bung on the drum released due to the drum being tipped over off of the pallet. The drum was re-secured to the pallet for shipment on and wiped down. All impacted absorbent pads were collected and containerized into a 5-gallon poly pail. The waste was transported to the XPO terminal located in Sherman, TX and staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023090354
item.description:
Report E-2023090354

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-18T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-17
  • City: GLENPOOL
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of descaler (un3264) had been punctured by a pallet and that one of the inner poly one gallon jug had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023061351
item.description:
Report X-2023061351

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-16T00:32:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF Railway Company
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PROX 45816 was found leaking in the Oklahoma City Flynn Yard by an FRA Inspector. The Inspector found a minor drip from the Bottom Outlet Valve (BOV). EMI was dispatched, inspected PROX 45816 and determined the BOV cap was less than tool tight with residual product in the cap. The BNSF Contractor properly secured PROX 45816 to mitigate the release.
